message: I particularly love that their status page is isolated from the rest of the site so it works by telling us that there is a serious disruption: http://status.github.com/
Nooooo! GitHuuuub! How will I survive? :(
*PHEW* No need to be social. Back to work.
Looks like github's down. Hope everything's going as well as can be expected bringing things back up?
I wish I could say I didn't work at a startup that's busy enough to notice within a few minutes anytime github blinks, but I do :|
and nice of them to go to the trouble.. since I think most folks just use their twitter account for that kind of independent "Well be up soon"-ing.
@fools well you'll just have to make a friend. Look around, I'm sure there's someone else in the room who's  git pull  just failed.
@varud totally. I think hosting the status site away from prod is key.
Now comes inevitable begging for a super-frank blog post about what went wrong in painstaking detail... you know, not from me.
@micrypt Github being down in 2011 is sort of like "Doing a build" in 1998. Just go get a bagel.. or a beer.
I'm at Starbucks, and I've gone through the bagel already. :'(.
Sorry about that, folks! Our database server heartbeat detected a non-responsive DB when it shouldn't have and took down the active MySQL. We should have a writeup of what happened soon.
Just to follow up on @mojombo's comment, the writeup is on the blog for anyone that's interested.
And here is the link to that blog post for anyone that's interested ;) https://github.com/blog/808-today-s-downtime
the only thing that isn't going all Jenkins on your database from time to time is Jenkins
